meaning: To introduce (something) as a reasoned conclusion; to conclude by reasoning or deduction, as from premises or evidence.
The act or process of inferring by deduction or induction.
To enlarge an object by pushing air (or a gas) into it; to raise or expand abnormally
example: You inflate a balloon by blowing air into it.

meaning: A person who has influence
example: Jane was very influential in getting the motion passed.

meaning: Not formal or ceremonious.
example: an informal get-together

meaning: Providing information; especially, providing useful or interesting information.
example: I read a very informative newspaper article on that subject last week.

meaning: One of the substances present in a mixture, especially food.
A pigment (or dye)-based fluid used for writing, printing etc.
example: The TSA has been getting a lot of ink lately.

meaning: Characterized by the creation of new ideas or inventions.
To ask (about something).
An image inserted into text.
example: This software can print compact disc inserts if you have the right size of paper.

meaning: To examine critically or carefully; especially, to search out problems or determine condition; to scrutinize.
example: Inspect the system for leaks.

meaning: The act of examining something, often closely.
example: Upon closer inspection, the animal turned out to be a dolphin, not a shark!

meaning: A person employed to inspect something.
The drawing of air into the lungs, accomplished in mammals by elevation of the chest walls and flattening of the diaphragm, as part of the act of respiration.
example: She was waiting for inspiration to write a book.

meaning: An act of installing.
An organization founded to promote a cause
example: I work in a medical research institute.

meaning: Instruction.
example: Listen carefully when someone instructs you how to assemble the furniture.

meaning: One who instructs; a teacher.
Not sufficient.
example: Insufficient time is available to reflect on the problem

meaning: A number, the limit of the sums computed in a process in which the domain of a function is divided into small subsets and a possibly nominal value of the function on each subset is multiplied by the measure of that subset, all these products then being summed.
example: The integral of x\mapsto x^2 on [0,1] is \frac{1}{3}.

meaning: In an intent or focused manner.
A feature (as in a museum) that can be interacted with.
example: interactive teaching methods

meaning: To get involved or involve oneself, causing disturbance.
example: I always try not to interfere with other people’s personal affairs.

meaning: A person who is interned, forcibly or voluntarily.
example: The US government interned thousands of Japanese-Americans during World War II.

meaning: In an international manner.
Any set of computer networks that communicate using the Internet Protocol. (An intranet.)
example: Do you have internet at your place?  My internet is down and I want to check my email.

meaning: A job taken by a student in order to learn a profession or trade.

One who conveys what a user of one language is saying or signing, in real time or shortly after that person has finished communicating, to a user of a different language. (Contrasted with a translator.)
example: A Japanese man who is tried before a German court is assisted by an interpreter in making oral statements.

meaning: An event that causes a computer or other device to temporarily cease what it was doing and attend to a condition.
example: The interrupt caused the packet handler routine to run.

meaning: The junction of two (or more) paths, streets, highways, or other thoroughfares.
The rise and fall of the voice in speaking.
example: Her intonation was false.

meaning: Introducing; giving a preview or idea of.
example: He enrolled in an introductory wine-making course.

meaning: Of great value; costly, precious, priceless.
Something invented.
example: I'm afraid there was no burglar. It was all the housekeeper's invention.

meaning: (operations) The stock of an item on hand at a particular location or business.
example: Due to an undersized inventory at the Boston outlet, customers had to travel to Providence to find the item.

meaning: A bill; a commercial document issued by a seller to a buyer indicating the products, quantities and agreed prices for products or services that the seller has already provided the buyer with. An invoice indicates that, unless paid in advance, payment is due by the buyer to the seller, according to the agreed terms.
example: The merchant receives a large invoice of goods.

meaning: A soldier who is not a member of an official military force and, often, does not follow regular army tactics
example: "Calves", "cacti", and "children" are irregular plurals.

meaning: Not related, not applicable, unimportant, not connected.
To provoke impatience, anger, or displeasure in.
A written schedule of activities for a vacation or road trip.
